intro: Matelea aliciae, commonly known as the Alicia's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common trait among members of its family. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Matelea aliciae is an important nectar source for various pollinators, including butterflies and bees.
